text:
Using Apache 1.3.24 on WinNT 4.0 / SP6a, I am still getting invalid host names 
in access.log: 

...
dove - - [27/Mar/2002:13:27:25 -0500] "GET /dLearn/db2ktutorial/0 ... etc.
...
emran - - [27/Mar/2002:14:39:54 -0500] etc.
...

(The changelog for 1.3.24 says that this problem was dealt with.)

Thank you
David Ball
admin@ChelseaData.ca
creator: admin@ChelseaData.ca

text:
The problem that was fixed was a very specific issue with "HostNameLookups off" and
"Deny from ...".  Can you confirm that you are talking about EXACTLY the same issue?
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
My apologies, I'm new at this!
I'm not talking about the same issue - I have HostNameLookups ON. The 1.3.24 
Changelog did not mention the details, just that invalid hostnames wouldn't 
show up anymore. Since I have been getting them only in the last month or two, 
I guessed that it was a common problem and that 1.3.24 was supposed to fix 
things. I checked the bug database under logging, but did not find any existing 
issues.
creator: admin@ChelseaData.ca

text:
I'd guess that your problem is simply clients with misconfigured reverse DNS
connecting to your server.  Try setting "HostnameLookups double" and see if that
makes it go away.  In general, you will want to have "HostnameLookups off" for
performance reasons, however.

In any case, unless you can confirm that this is a bug, it is better discussed
in a user form like the apache users mailing list.

Thanks.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
Once again, my apologies. It must be just a strange coincidence that invalid 
hostnames have been showing up just in the last month or two. I will try your 
suggestions.
